doc.previous: That is, the probability function f(x) lies between zero and one for every value of x in the sample space Î©, and the sum of f(x) over all values x in the sample space Î© is equal to 1. An event is defined as any subset of the sample space . The probability of the event is defined as
doc.after: So, the probability of the entire sample space is 1, and the probability of the null event is 0.
